Class Clear

  • java.lang.Object
    • Clear
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Encryptor, Hasher

    public class Clear
extends Object
implements Encryptor, Hasher
    This serves as both an Encryptor and Hasher There is no changing of the input when encrypting or decrypting It does ensure that all input and output are of valid characters

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Clear() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String decrypt(String cipher)
      Takes an encrypted string, ensures all characters are in range, decrypts it, and returns the plain text back
      String encrypt(String plain)
      Takes a string, ensures that it is in the valid character set, encrypts it, and returns that cipher back
      String getAlgName()
      Gets the name of this type of algorithm
      String getHashName()
      Gets the name of the hash algorithm
      String hash(char[] password)
      Hashes a given char array, and then returns the result as a string
      void init(char[] key)
      Initialized the encryptor with the given key, so that subsequent use is ready to encrypt/decrypt without entering the key Since this algorithm does not use a key, it ultimately checks for valid characters

      • init

        public void init(char[] key)
          throws BadCharException
        Initialized the encryptor with the given key, so that subsequent use is ready to encrypt/decrypt without entering the key Since this algorithm does not use a key, it ultimately checks for valid characters
        Specified by:
        init in interface Encryptor
        Parameters:
        key - A char array of the key to be saved
        Throws:
        BadCharException - If any char in the key is not in the valid range, this exception is thrown

      • encrypt

        public String encrypt(String plain)
               throws BadCharException
        Takes a string, ensures that it is in the valid character set, encrypts it, and returns that cipher back
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface Encryptor
        Parameters:
        plain - The string of the plain text to be encrypted
        Returns:
        The cipher string (encrypted)
        Throws:
        BadCharException - If any char in the plain text is invalid, this exception is thrown

      • decrypt

        public String decrypt(String cipher)
               throws BadCharException
        Takes an encrypted string, ensures all characters are in range, decrypts it, and returns the plain text back
        Specified by:
        decrypt in interface Encryptor
        Parameters:
        cipher - The string of the cipher to be decryped
        Returns:
        The plain text string (decrypted)
        Throws:
        BadCharException - If any char in the cipher is invalid, this exception is thrown
